tfidf module¶

tfidf.compute_tfidf(corpus)[source]¶

Create and return a TfidfVectorizer object after training it on the list of articles pulled from the corpus dictionary. The corpus argument is a dictionary mapping file name to xml text.

tfidf.gettext_plain(text)[source]¶
tfidf.gettext_xml(xmltext)[source]¶

Parse xmltext and return the text from <title> and <text> tags

tfidf.load_corpus(zipfilename)[source]¶

Given a zip file containing root directory reuters-vol1-disk1-subset and a bunch of *.xml files, read them from the zip file into a dictionary of (word,xmltext) associations. Use namelist() from ZipFile object to get list of xml files in that zip file. Convert filename reuters-vol1-disk1-subset/foo.xml to foo.xml as the keys in the dictionary. The values in the dictionary are the raw XML text from the various files.

tfidf.stemwords(words)[source]¶

Given a list of tokens/words, return a new list with each word stemmed using a PorterStemmer.

tfidf.summarize(tfidf, text, n=0)[source]¶

Given a trained TfidfVectorizer object and some XML text, return up to n (word,score) pairs in a list.

tfidf.tokenize(text)[source]¶

Tokenize text and return a non-unique list of tokenized words found in the text. Normalize to lowercase, strip punctuation, remove stop words, drop words of length < 3.

tfidf.tokenizer(text)[source]¶
tfidf.words(text)[source]¶

Given a string, return a list of words normalized as follows. Split the string to make words first by using regex compile() function and string.punctuation + ‘0-9rtn]’ to replace all those char with a space character. Split on space to get word list. Ignore words < 3 char long. Lowercase all words
